intro: Fumaria officinalis var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered common celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and hedgerows. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
